deck: A vehicular combat game for the NES. It was originally called Battle Formula in Japan, but Sunsoft purchased the license to Spy Hunter and was able to market the game as a sequel to the Spy Hunter game.
name: Super Spy Hunter

deck: Known as the granddaddy of the "Quick Time Event", Dragon's Lair is an interactive cartoon that lets players help guide the actions of brave knight Dirk the Daring, as he ventures through the dangerous castle of Singe the Dragon in order to rescue his beloved princess Daphne.
name: Dragon's Lair

deck: This game, based on Star Wars Episode IV: A New Hope, features both platforming and shooting segments.
name: Star Wars

deck: Balloon Fight is an arcade-style platform action game for 1-2 players that is similar to Joust. Players take to the sky and try to pop their foes' balloons before their own get popped.
name: Balloon Fight

deck: The Immortal is an isometric adventure game which puts you in the shoes of an apprentice wizard who sets out to rescue his old mentor from a trap-filled dungeon.
name: The Immortal

deck: A vertically-scrolling Arcade shoot 'em up that was later ported to the Nintendo Famicom with a few changes.
name: B-Wings

deck: Flying Warriors is an action game which takes elements from the second and third Hiryu no Ken games.
name: Flying Warriors

deck: John Elway's Quarterback is a vertical-scrolling Football sim that features the former Denver Broncos quarterback's likeness. Originally released in Arcades, it was later ported to various home systems.
name: John Elway's Quarterback

deck: A bowling simulator for the Famicom. It allowed for up to five players and was the first bowling game for the system.
name: Dynamite Bowl

deck: Captain Planet and the Planeteers was a game based on the television show of the same name in the early nineties.
name: Captain Planet and the Planeteers

deck: CheetahMen II is an unreleased sequel to a minigame originally on Action 52 for the Nintendo Entertainment System and Sega Genesis. It is infamous for its mediocre gameplay and highly buggy programming state.
name: CheetahMen II

deck: A NES platformer where you play as Fred Flintstone as his pets Dino and Hoppy are kidnapped by a collector from the future. A small alien comes back in time to help them, and Fred must find the parts of his time machine to save them.
name: The Flintstones: The Rescue of Dino & Hoppy

deck: The Earth is now underwater and being attacked by the evil Neptunians! Save all the imprisoned humans with a tricked-out pink submarine.
name: Sqoon

deck: Control Jumpman (later known as Mario) and save his girlfriend, Pauline, from the evil barrel-tossing gorilla known as Donkey Kong. Designed by Shigeru Miyamoto, this was the game that set the template for the platformer genre.
name: Donkey Kong

deck: A competitive multiplayer action game based on the TV game show American Gladiators. Players compete against the clock and each other to complete events and obstacle courses.
name: American Gladiators

deck: A fantasy action game published for the NES in 1990.
name: King Neptune's Adventure

deck: A fantasy-themed Japanese side-scrolling platformer for the NES, developed by Carry Lab (or Carry Soft) and published in the US by Taxan.
name: Mystery Quest

deck: All-Pro Basketball is a basketball game for the NES.
name: All-Pro Basketball

deck: Platoon is the video game based off of Oliver Stone's "Platoon".
name: Platoon

deck: An action platformer game that sees a ninja take on a group of kidnappers.
name: Wrath of the Black Manta

deck: Following the invasion of Earth by fish-like aliens, you must assume the role of a S.C.A.T. soldier and halt the onslaught!
name: S.C.A.T.: Special Cybernetic Attack Team

deck: A vertical shoot 'em up and an update to the original game that contains new enemies.
name: Super Xevious

deck: One of the first console baseball games to include real MLB players. The players were super deformed and had no likeness to the real players other than their stats and their names.
name: R.B.I. Baseball

deck: Lode Runner is a 2D platform/Puzzle game from 1983 created by Douglas Smith. It is one of the first games to include a level editor tool for players to create their own levels.
name: Lode Runner

deck: This 1986 sequel added more enemies with better AI, new treasures, harder levels, and the ability for each player to choose the character they wanted.
name: Gauntlet II

deck: Summer Carnival '92 - Recca was only released in Japan, on July 17th 1992. The game is famous for its incredible speed, unique soundtrack, and relentless difficulty. It later was released worldwide on the 3DS eShop.
name: Summer Carnival '92: Recca

deck: An early action-strategy-RPG game created by Koji Sumii and published by ASCII for the Sharp X1 computer in 1983. The game is considered a precursor to several genres: the action RPG, tactical RPG, real-time strategy, and tower defense.
name: Bokosuka Wars

deck: The sequel to Impossible Mission
name: Impossible Mission-II

deck: WCW: World Championship Wrestling is a wrestling game released for the NES in 1990. It is a WCW re-skin of the developers 1989 title Super Star Pro Wrestling.
name: WCW: World Championship Wrestling

deck: King Drake of Phoebus has declared all magic illegal, slaying or exiling those who resist. In retaliation, the neighboring island nations threaten to unleash their dragons as the world teeters on the edge of war. Wrongly imprisoned, you and your friends must somehow escape in order to seek your revenge.
name: Dragon Wars

deck: Featuring various improvements to the system introduced in the first Bard's Tale, the Destiny Knight takes a party of adventurers across six cities in an effort to recover the shattered pieces of the Destiny Wand and confront the Archmage responsible for the chaos, Lagoth Zanta.
name: The Bard's Tale II: The Destiny Knight

deck: A side-scrolling shoot 'em up that is a Gradius parody - hence, "Parodius".
name: Parodius

deck: Released in 1993 for the Family Computer.
name: Wily & Right no RockBoard: That's Paradise

deck: Contra Force is the third game in the Contra franchise, but has nearly no ties to the main franchise, and is often considered a spin-off.
name: Contra Force

deck: Originally released in 1987, Pac-Mania featured a unique take on the Pac-Man formula.
name: Pac-Mania

deck: First person space combat for the NES.
name: Star Voyager

deck: A side-scrolling action/shooter based on the 1987 Schwarzenegger movie Predator. It was published by Activision for many home computers, though its NES incarnation plays slightly differently.
name: Predator

deck: A turn-based strategy game for the NES in which the player takes on the role of Japanese warlord Shingen Takeda during the 16th Century.
name: Shingen the Ruler

deck: Magician is a side-scrolling RPG.
name: Magician

deck: A fast-paced puzzle-platformer that debuted in arcades, and later moved to home gaming systems; including the Commodore 64, NES, and Nintendo's Virtual Console.
name: Solomon's Key

deck: A turn-based strategy game originally released in 1987 by Koei, the creators of Nobunaga's Ambition and Romance of the Three Kingdoms.
name: Genghis Khan

deck: One of several video game adaptations of the popular Merv Griffin quiz show Jeopardy!, where contestants are given answers and must determine the questions that lead to them. This particular game was the first of the Rare-developed Jeopardy! games for NES.
name: Jeopardy!

deck: A shooting game developed by Hudson.
name: Star Soldier

deck: A video game adaptation of the 1987 movie regarding Eliot Ness, notorious gangster Al Capone and the Prohibition era. The SNES version is based on the 1993 TV series instead.
name: The Untouchables

deck: One of the progenitors of Japanese RPGs, The Black Onyx brings the world of high-fantasy RPGs to Japanese computers as five brave adventurers set out through a deep underground labyrinth to find the legendary Black Onyx and break a curse set upon on the fantasy town of Utsuro.
name: The Black Onyx

deck: In Godzilla 2 you are charged with defending objectives from Godzilla and the other monsters of Toho movie fame. Take control of the military and hope not to get stepped on or try your luck at killing the giant monsters.
name: Godzilla 2: War of the Monsters

deck: Classic NES platformer in which the game continuously scrolls to the right. Players must use the NES Zapper accessory to make the character (Gumshoe) avoid obstacles and reach platforms. The Zapper can also be used to shoot enemies in the path. Gumshoe was published and developed by Nintendo.
name: Gumshoe

deck: The 8-Bit adaptation of Final Fight featuring super-deformed style characters.
name: Mighty Final Fight

deck: Mig-29 Soviet Fighter is a jet fighting game released on the NES and many early computer systems.
name: Mig-29 Soviet Fighter

deck: Phantom Fighter is an action game for the NES, the object of the game is to defeat the numerous Kyonshi (Chinese vampires) and bosses at the end of each of the eight levels.
name: Phantom Fighter

deck: A compilation of four Codemasters sports titles for the Amiga, ZX Spectrum, and NES.
name: Quattro Sports

deck: Deep Dungeon IV: Kuro no Youjutsushi is a Japanese only role-playing game for the Nintendo Famicom.
name: Deep Dungeon IV: Kuro no Youjutsushi

deck: A side-scrolling action game set in a dangerous future.
name: Kabuki: Quantum Fighter

deck: Mega Man's former ally, Proto Man, creates an army of destructive robots and kidnaps Dr. Light, and it's up to Mega Man to stop him in this fifth installment of the Mega Man series.
name: Mega Man 5

deck: Control Jason Frudnick in his sweet battle-tank as he blasts his way through eight levels of dudes!
name: Blaster Master

deck: A vertical-scrolling shoot-em-up from Nihon Bussan, created originally for the Arcades and later ported to various home systems. It features a power-up system that causes the player's ship to change its appearance.
name: Terra Cresta

deck: Play as Luke Skywalker as you fight your way through the Battle of Hoth, travel through the swamps of Dagobah, and explore Cloud City
name: Star Wars: The Empire Strikes Back

deck: R.C Pro-Am II is an isometric track racer with power ups for the NES. It boasts a variety of themed tracks aswell as vehicles.
name: R.C. Pro-Am II

deck: New Ghostbusters II was a game for the NES and Game Boy developed by Hal that was only released in Europe.
name: New Ghostbusters II

deck: RoboWarrior (Bomber King in Japan) is a side-scrolling action game for the NES, developed by Hudson and later published in the US by Jaleco. It is a sequel to Hudson's earlier hit Bomberman.
name: RoboWarrior

deck: An isometric combat racing game that was developed by Rare in 1988.
name: R.C. Pro-Am

deck: A pirate simulator created by the renowned game designer Sid Meier. Contains looting, swordsmanship and all around swashbuckling. The game was remade in 1993 for the PC; it was also reimagined in 2004 for the PC and Xbox.
name: Sid Meier's Pirates!

deck: A shoot 'em up where the player controls Captain Commando as he infiltrates an enemy space fortress, blasting his way from Section-A straight through to the titular Section-Z.
name: Section-Z

deck: Guide hordes of helpless green-haired rodents away from peril in this landmark puzzle game.
name: Lemmings

deck: An arcade-style action game released for the MSX computer in 1984 and later ported to the Nintendo Famicom console titled as Astro Robo SASA (SASA) in 1985. The protagonist uses a gun's recoil to fly around stage, collecting additional energy containers.
name: Astro Robo Sasa

deck: Xevious is one of the first vertical scrolling shoot-em-up arcade games.
name: Xevious

deck: A scrolling platformer for the Nintendo Entertainment System developed by Hudson Soft, the game was an adaptation of the Westone/Sega arcade game Wonder Boy featuring an employee of Hudson wearing a grass skirt.
name: Adventure Island

deck: This Acclaim published NES game was the first Square game to reach North America. The game was developed by both Hironobu Sakaguchi and Nobuo Uematsu.
name: 3-D WorldRunner

deck: A basketball game by Konami, originally for the Arcade and ported to home consoles. It is part of Konami's "Exciting" sports series.
name: Double Dribble

deck: Caesars Palace brings the excitement of Las Vegas home.
name: Caesars Palace

deck: A top-down shooter where one or two bandana-wearing commandos fight enemy forces in a jungle. It is notable for allowing the player to pilot various vehicles including a tank and a helicopter.
name: Ikari Warriors

deck: NES game from Konami based on the 1980's TV Series. It used the same game engine as Metal Gear.
name: Mission: Impossible

deck: Destiny of an Emperor is a strategy role-playing game based roughly on the manga Tenchi o Kurau ("The Devouring of Heaven and Earth") which is set in the Three Kingdoms period, when Western Shu, Northern Wei and Eastern Wu battled to conquer all of China.
name: Destiny of an Emperor

deck: The first in a series of adventure-RPG adaptations of the world of the manga and anime Dragon Ball. It takes place during the "King Piccolo Saga" arc of the series and features a unique card-based system for both exploration and combat.
name: Dragon Ball: Daimaou Fukkatsu

deck: Step into the shoes of the ninja Ryu Hayabusa as he goes on a quest to avenge his father's unexpected death.
name: Ninja Gaiden

deck: Shanghai is a virtual simulation of the classic puzzle game also known as Mahjong Solitaire.
name: Shanghai

deck: An arcade basketball game endorsed by Earvin "Magic" Johnson Jr.
name: Magic Johnson's Fast Break

deck: An 8-bit RPG on the NES developed by Game Arts and published by Nexoft. The player controls a female warrior out on a quest.
name: Faria: A World of Mystery and Danger!

deck: Play as either Hayate or Kaede in this fast-paced action platformer. This game is known as "Blue Shadow" in Europe.
name: Shadow of the Ninja

deck: A horizontal shoot 'em up based on the hit Disney cartoon featuring characters inspired by The Jungle Book. Part of Capcom's series of Disney licensed games from the late 80s and early 90s.
name: Disney's TaleSpin

deck: Play pinball alone or in a double-ended competitive format in Rock 'n' Ball.
name: Rock 'n Ball

deck: A horror action platformer game based on the movie of the same name, released on a multitude of platforms from 1993 on, developed by Psygnosis, Traveller's Tales, and Probe Entertainment and published by Sony Imagesoft and Psygnosis.
name: Bram Stoker's Dracula

deck: A sliding puzzle game for the NES.
name: Puzzle

deck: Collect pollen and attack other insects to protect your honey in this whimsical Codemasters game.
name: Bee 52

deck: An open world RPG with three character classes, and no password or save system for your progress.
name: Wizards & Warriors III: Kuros: Visions of Power

deck: This game is considered a sequel to the original arcade TMNT and was only released for the NES.
name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles III: The Manhattan Project

deck: Nightshade is a humorous adventure game for the NES.
name: Nightshade

deck: The last of the NES Ninja Gaiden trilogy.
name: Ninja Gaiden III: The Ancient Ship of Doom

deck: A football game from Nintendo for the NES
name: NES Play Action Football

deck:
Quattro Arcade is a game that was originally released for the Nintendo Entertainment System in 1992. It featured 4 games in one cartridge.
1.  F-16 Renegade
2.  C.J.s Elephant Antics
3.  Go! Dizzy Go!
4.  Stunt Buggies
name: Quattro Arcade

deck: A puzzle game by Tecmo, in which the player must extinguish fires using blocks of ice to clear stages of increasing difficulty. It is a prequel to Solomon's Key, and was known in most regions as Solomon's Key 2.
name: Fire 'n Ice

deck: Classic turn based strategy game based on the classic Chinese novel "Water Margin."
name: Bandit Kings of Ancient China

deck: A sequel to Saint Seiya: Ougon Densetsu, based on the Saint Seiya anime and manga. It was only released in Japan for the Famicom.
name: Saint Seiya: Ougon Densetsu - Kanketsu Hen

deck: This shape-based Russian mind-bender set the stage for innumerable puzzle games to follow.
name: Tetris

deck: A NES platformer released in Japan, August 9th 1991.
name: Armadillo

deck: The first in the Heracles no Eikou series of Ancient Greek-themed JRPGs created for the Famicom.
name: Heracles no Eikou: Toujin Makyou Den
